page.title: 10Stoke Albany Manor
page.content: Mr and Mrs Kelley own Stoke Manor. It is a very big house. The new part was built in 1680. The old part was built in the 13th century. The old kitchen was a bakery and is now a lavatory. They have beams in nearly every room. Only some of the beams are from ship timbers. The ceilings are quite low in the new part. In the old part the ceilings are quite low. The staircase is made of oak beams. They built the new part of the house around the staircase. Once the stairs used to be outside. The walls are 99cm thick. Nicolas De Rus built the house. He changed his name to Nicolas De Albany. That is where Stoke Albany got its name. They have a huge kitchen which used to be the dairy. The oldest beams are the ones in the loft. In one of the rooms there is an old fireplace. The spiral staircase is very steep.
